bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Bobby Proctor
bike_checks.description:
Have you ridden with this dude? If not, you need to. One of the most positive folks on the planet, and a master pie-maker at Nice Slice in Providence.

We love Bobby Proctor. Here’s his latest rig build care of Circuit Bmx.

Thanks Bobby!

Age: 25
Hometown: Providence Ri
Favorite spots: Prov Park, and any given neighborhood in providence.


Complete list of parts:
Forks: fbm cb4k
Rims: big baller sun ringle
Bars: fbm us apes
Grips: odi “o” grip
Pegs: shadow little ones

Cranks: profile column, Sprocket: Profile Galaxy

Pedals: eclat
Seat: fbm compass
Seat post: odyssey

Hubs: Profile Mini’s in the Swell colorway

Hub gaurds: Profile Aegis

Headset: fbm
Bottom bracket: profile 22mm
Chain: kmc 410h

Stem: Profile Mulville Push

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Craig Stevens
bike_checks.description:
Craig Stevens is another one of Profile’s longtime family members. From South Africa, to Bristol UK, and now to New Zealand. He’s handling the TM position for Etnies in NZ, handling fatherdon, and still handling the shred.

Here’s his rig, thanks for the support, Craig!

Age: 34

Hometown Durban South Africa / Bristol UK

Current residence: Auckland New Zealand

Favorite spots: Any good concrete / Trails with a good crew

This machine is a triumph of steel: its fast, gnarly and radical. It also ticks all the appropriate boxes for the ageing fan of the chromoly toy.

Front and Rear matt black Profile Elite hubs on Sun rims

Raw Profile 175 race cranks with a 28th sabre spline drive chain ring

Relic railed seat on a relic post, Bicycle union top tube pad for Table shin protection

2015 T-1 Barcode stripped to the bone, Mulville Push stem Matt black, Bicycle union Motorcade bars –raw

Photos by S and F Joe!

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in my Mike Saavedra
bike_checks.description:
Mike Saavedra has been part of the Profile family since time immemorial. Here’s his latest Profile X SandM build after coming back from his Barcelona bike caper. Thanks for the support, Mike! All photos by Dallas Dunn.

Frame/Creedence MOD, Fork/ S&M

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Ryan Torrance
bike_checks.description:
Ryan Torrance has been making waves in the FL Scene. Check out his wild moves at any given FLbmx stop this year. In the meantime, here’s his latest Deco Bmx X Profile Racing build. Thanks for the support, Ryan!

Profile Column Cranks, Profile 22mm Mid BB kit, Profile Sabre Sprocket.

Age: 27 years young
Hometown: Erie, Pennsylvania
Favorite spots: anything with a little transition to get things going!! R.I.P to my top favorite, Grinds in the hood in Tampa, Florida. Other than that, my local park, Payne skate park in Sarasota,Florida. It has a real good mix of everything you need!! Also Arvada skate park in Colorado is a must, you couldn’t even hit everything in one day if you wanted too!!

Profile ZCoaster. 14mm GDH, 9t chromo, 90 slack ring.

Profile Elite front hub w/ 3/8 17mm hex bolts.

Profile Push Stem.

Deco Self titled frame, Deco FuForks, Deco Mustache Bars.

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Shawn Bilslend
bike_checks.description:
Have you heard of the Grapefruit Trails? This is the architect to that paradise in the jungle.
Thanks for the love and support, Shawn. She is a dialer!

Age: 45
Home Town: Vassalboro, Maine
Favorite spots: GFT, the Shaw compound, “Hawknest” down south, and of course Catty!!!! Gonna make it to Posh next time around
Parts: custom frame, built by Mike Maloney, and painted by one of the best dudes ever, Taj.

Profile Columns: 170mm, Profile Mid BB, Profile Galaxy sprocket 28t

Profile Mulville seat

DRG Pumpa Knuck stem (made in Maine baby!!!)

Profile Elites MTB Front and Rear, Sunringle MTX31 front and rear.

Blkmrkt US made cromo bars 3″rise
HollyRoller up front, and a PowerBlock in the back
Deluxe pedals and grips

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Ooti Billeaud
bike_checks.description:
Thanks to Ooti for years of support. Here’s his latest build. Love the thought that goes into this. Dialed!
Name: Ooti Billeaud / @ooti / www.ootibilleaud.com
Age: 29
Height: 5’7″
Weight: 160 lbs.
Tire Pressure: 70 PSI
Hometown: I’m from Lafayette, LA but I’ve been in New Orleans 6 years now.
Favorite Spots: That’s tough but in New Orleans I mostly ride downtown, this unofficial street plaza on the Mississippi river called Barcenola (cause it looks like it would be in Barcelona), and the @parisite_diy and @wentwoodskate skateparks.

Frame: Sunday Soundwave V2 20.75″

Fork: S&M Widemouth (26mm) cut flush with stem

Bars: Terrible One Classic 8.85″ USA’s cut to 26.5″

Stem: Profile Push 53mm

Cranks: Profile Column 165mm with Titanium spindle

Headset: FSA sealed

Grips: ODI Longneck ST

Bar Ends: Animal Plastic

Seat: Fiend Ty Morrow Vinyl Tripod

Seat Post: Cult Tripod

Seat Post Clamp: Profile Slim Jim

Sprocket: Madera Signet Guard Spline Drive 28t

Driver: Profile CrMo 9t

Pedals: Fly Plastic Ruben

Shoes: Vans vulcanized with thick soles

Chain: Cult 510

Front Wheel: Profile Mini Front Hub, Profile hex bolts, DT Spokes, Gsport Ribcage Rim

Rear Wheel: Profile Mini Cassette Hub, Profile Titanium axle, DT Spokes, Gsport Ribcage Rim

Front Tire: BSD Donnastreet 2.30″

Rear Tire: BSD Donnastreet 2.30″

Weight: 23 lbs.

Rear End: 13.5″

Mods: Cut the handlebars to 26.5″, cut the steerer tube flush with the stem with no spacers, cut the rear axle flush with the axle nuts, cut the flanges off the grips

Notes: I’ve been wanting to try a Soundwave frame for about 6 years now as I like beefy, stiff frames (of which there are few) not to mention all the other cool things about it.  Compared to my Barcode frame, the Soundwave has a shorter rear end (13.5″), a lower bottom bracket (11.5″), a higher top tube (9″), and a longer as well as steeper head tube (75 degrees).  It also has the “Black Mag” rust-proof coating inside and out which I’m assuming is just an ED coating.  I had a Loosefer frame years ago with an ED coating and loved it so I’m happy to have that rust protection especially in New Orleans with all the rain and perpetual humidity.  It also has the Wave top and down tube which is supposed to make them more dent resistant and consequently make the frame more resistant to cracking which doesn’t really matter to me cause I don’t grind and baby my frames anyway.  The boxed chain stays look really beefy as well as stiff which is exactly what I want in a rear end.  This frame also allows bigger tires and I’d been wanting to try some that were slightly larger than the Hawk P-Lyte 2.20″’s for a while now.  I’m really digging the built-in chain tensioners and can’t believe I waited this long to try a frame that had them although I also want to try the Simple Wheel Slammer spacers to keep my chain tight.  I’ve been riding a spline drive sprocket for a few years now and love it.  I recently downsized to a 28t spline drive sprocket when I finally realized that the 30t had been overkill for years and that I’d rather be spinning out on a 28t than ride a 30t.  I don’t grind or do sprocket stalls but I wanted a guard sprocket to keep oil off my pants as well as keep them and my shoe laces from getting caught in the chain.  It also helps keep oil off of you if your bike is laying down and you’re sitting on the sprocket side of the frame.  I got the Terrible One Classic bars in 8.85″ a while back and the geometry on them has consistently proven to be my favorite of any bars over the last 15 years.  The 8.85″ height with the Push Stem feels perfect to me and the 26.5″ width remains my favorite in the last 10 years after trying wider and narrower bars over the years, especially in regard to turndowns and tables.  Profile still makes the best hubs and ODI still makes the best grips.  I also switched to a steeper offset fork (26mm) and love it.  I feel like it’s more responsive and easier to balance on without losing any of the stability of a 30mm+ fork.  I’m liking the 2.3″ Donnastreet tires; they have a tear resistant silkworm casing just like the Ruben tires which I love and I like how they grip so far.  I also got a vinyl Ty Morrow Tripod seat and it’s super comfortable, well designed, and clean looking.  It seems like it could tear easily but it doesn’t touch the ground when I flip my bike upside down and I never throw my bike.  I still love the Tripod system.  I loved the Column cranks in 175mm but wanted to try shorter 165mm Column cranks as it seems like a lot of ramp, street, and trail riders are saying they allow more control and make certain tricks easier.  Lastly, I took my brakes off again.  I just can’t get away from how clean and simple a bike looks without brakes not to mention how fluid it forces you to be in your riding.  I never rode with my finger on the lever, I don’t do brake tricks, and there are no trails in or around New Orleans, not to mention New Orleans itself is very flat.  Not having brakes removes such a huge portion of bike maintenance as well which is super nice if you don’t have a lot of time to work on your bike.  I haven’t had enough time on the Soundwave to really form an opinion on how I like the geometry, not to mention the fact that I put on shorter cranks and bigger tires at the same time but time will tell.  I’m really excited to ride and get used to this bike.  It’s amazing to look at how far BMX technology has come in the last 20 years and it never stops improving and innovating.

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Mark Mulville
bike_checks.description:
Mark Mulville has had one of the longest tenures on Profile Racing.
Besides being one of our longest running riders on the Pro Team, he manages our social media.
Get at him on Instagram @markmulville
We’re stoked on his continued support. Here’s his latest rig check.

Frame: Standard Trail Boss

Age: 33 years old.
Hometown: Cocoa Beach, Florida.
Favorite spots: Grapefruit Trails, the beach, and anywhere involving good pals.

Hubs: Profile Elites/ Rims: Sun Big Ballers

Forks: Deco Fuforks

Cranks: Profile 22mm Column Cranks / Sprocket: Profile Galaxy Spline Drive / Pedals: Deco pedals

Stem: Profile Signature Push stem / Bars: Deluxe bars / Grips: Deco Logo grips  / Headset: Deco headset

Seat: Profile Signature “P” seat / Seat Post: Deco pivotal post / Seat Post Clamp: Profile Slim Jim

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Josh Hayes
bike_checks.description:
Vienna, Austria via San Diego, California.
Here’s Josh Hayes’ latest build.
Thanks for the support, Josh….dialed.

Mutiny Vilij 21.25

OG Odyssey Lumberjack bars from like 8 years ago as well as some OG Odyssey Race forks from like 8 years ago: They may or may not need to be replaced.

Profile Push 53mm with the heavy bolts cause I am not as cool as the cool kids. 8 year old odyssey what ever headset.

Profile 175mm Column cranks. Steel spindle. Hollow bolts. Profile Sabre 36t Raw Sprocket. I guess these are not normal but they should be because raw is radical! Odyssey Grandstand pedals but wishing I had some Profile Gas Pedals.

36 Hole Profile Elite Polished. Titanium Cog driver w/12tooth cog. 3/8 inner Aluminum axle with one chromo 17mm hex bolt and one peg dome bolt for the days I feel like doing some sick grinds.

36 Hole Profile Elite Front 3/8 inner Aluminum axle with chromo 17mm hex bolts.

7KA 36h Black with Sapim straight gauge spokes.

Front Hub Guard: Something awesome from Profile or Madera

Rear Hub Guard: Again Something Awesome from Profile or Madera

Tires: Fly Ruben 2.4 front and rear.
Grips: T1 grips because T1

Pegs: What ever I could find for cheap. They are metal and slide things when I have them on my bike.

bike_checks.description:
Name: Dani Windhausen
Hometown: Central Square, NY
Favorite riding spots (for bmx): Mabel Davis skatepark (in Austin), my backyard, Ruben’s park in Malaga, lots of Colorado/Oregon concrete, any bowl with a good deep end/good hips, anywhere with good friends!
Favorite cruising spots (for your cruiser): So far I’ve just been cruising it around town (Austin), also there is a great bike path right by my house that’s super fun to cruise. But I plan on getting this thing dialed for some bike packing adventures too!!

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Lucas Porzio
bike_checks.description:
Lucas has been on a shred-page lately. Here’s his latest rig check. Thanks to him for years and years of support.

 

Name: Lucas Porzio
Age: 37
Hometown: St. Pete, Fl. for now
Favorite spots: Just about anywhere that puts a smile on my face. If I could hop on a plane right this second though: AZ State U and the Chandler BMX Park.
Frame:         S&M  ATF  21″
Fork:            T-1
Bars:            S&M credence 8.7″
Grips:           ODI longnecks with the outside flange cut off
Stem:          Profile acoustic
H/S:             Deco
S/P:             Deco
Seat:            Profile
Sprocket:     Profile spline drive 30T / 10T driver
Cranks:        Profile 180mm
Pedals:         Profile gas pedals slim/ 2nd gen
Chain:           KMC K710sl
Brake lever:  tech77 (older than dirt)
Brakes:         FLY first gen
Grips:           ODI
Tires:            Demolition momentum up front
                     CST decade in the back
Hoops:         FLY first gen (always wanted to  ride them, thank you jeren)
Hubs:           Profile mini
Hub guards: profile front and rear

Thank you matt, and everyone over at profileracing, and also mike over at escapthislivephx.com.  You guys are awesome. Cheers

Lucas in the old AZ home. Pic care of Bmx Plus!

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Greg Mundy’s Fireman’s Texas Cruiser
bike_checks.description:
Thanks to Greg and Fireman’s Texas Cruisers out of Austin for years of support. Here’s a breakdown of his latest rig build with some Profile gems.

Appreciate it Greg!

Firemans 2017 Big Al aluminum frame with black chromoly FM fork built by
Bradley (one  of my head mechanics).

‘old school’ well worn profile SS cranks – crank assembly including BB
weighs 5 lb(!) I weighed it back in the day.

‘old school’ well worn profile stem  (look at the hammer marks from an old
bike where I had to install on a tight fork)

Profile repro 1983 hubs laced with black DT spokes and silver stainless
nipples to sun rhino lite 36H rims- built by WHEELIEMAN (one of my head
mechanics).

  

All photos by Ben Mundy.

bike_checks.title: Matt Coplon’s Rig Check
bike_checks.description:
It usually takes a good two years to build up a new rig. This one started 6 months ago when I called up the John’s at FBM about building a custom frame. I’ve had the same frame dimensions for the past 8 years, love it, and hate to think of having to stray from that. Combined with our machinist, Dave Fisher’s, attention to detail, I was lucky enough to get some dialed, custom mods added to the build accompanied by certain Deco components I can’t ride without. I’m a creature of habit, so thanks to Profile, FBM, and Deco for allowing those creature comforts.

– Matt Coplon-

Frame: FBM Custom
Forks:Deco FuForks 28mm
Bars: From my secret stash of Country 711 Bars (discontinued)
Stem: Profile Push 48mm with titanium bolts
Headset: Deco
Cranks: Profile 160mm No Boss with titanium spindle and 7075 Aluminum bolts
Sprocket: Profile classic 19mm spline drive 25t
Pedals: Profile 2nd generation Gas Pedals
Chain: KMC 510
Post: Deco pivotal (short)
Seat: Deco Terry Adams

Rear Hub: 36 Hole Profile custom Mini Hub with reversed scallop machining
9t Aluminum driver
3/8 inner Aluminum axle with one chromo bolt and one custom titanium beach bolt

Front Hub: 28 Hole Profile custom Mini Hub with reversed scallop machining
3/8 inner Aluminum axle with one chromo bolt and one custom titanium beach bolt

Rims: Sun Envy 1.5
Spokes: Inner Marwi Titanium spokes (from a secret stash) with outer double butted Wheelsmith
Front Hub Guard: Madera C-4
Rear Hub Guard: Custom Madera C-4 for 3/8

Tires: Demolition Momentum 2.2
Grips: ODI soft

Pegs: Profile 7075 Aluminum

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Mat Olson
bike_checks.description:
Mat Olson
29 years young
Born in Lake Havasu City, AZ
My favorite spot to ride is at any set of trails. There just isn’t another feeling like it out there. Although I’m not opposed to checking out a double kink rail or searching out every drainage ditch in town. Bikes are fun no matter what your riding.

Deco ST Frame
Deco FuForks 28mm
Profile Mini Front Hub in Camo
Profile Mini Rear Hub 14mm 9t Chromo
Profile Column 175mm
Profile Galaxy Matte Army Green 28t
Deco Mustache Bars
Deco Fat Camo Seat
Deco Headset
Profile 22mm Mid BB Kit

bike_checks.title: Dialing it in with Zach Zeuschel
bike_checks.description:
Name: Zach Zeuschel

Age:25

Hometown: born in St. Louis Missouri, Lived on site at Camp Woodward for 6 years, and now am currently living one town over from Woodward (Lewistown PA) in my own home with my wife.

Favorite spots to ride: Well of course Woodward is my favorite especially the vert ramp! But right up there with Woodward is my hometown park Ramp Riders in St.Louis MO I learned every thing there. I also enjoy myself at Rays MTB park in Ohio. Pretty much I could have fun riding a curb as long as there is a rad group of riders and everyone is happy to just be on their bikes!

Parts list: Here we go!

Frame: custom Standard STA500
Fork: Standard Bash w/990’s
Bars: custom Standard Strip 4-piece

Stem: Profile Racing “push” 48mm Ti bolts
Headset: Box Glide Ti/carbon/ceramic
Gyro plate: 34r clito w/Ti set screw
Gyro: Odyssey Gtx-S w/Ti set screws
Brake levers: Paul love lever comp Sealed bearing w/Ti hardware.

Brake cables: Gold Nokon housing w/ KCNC gold Titanium wires (yes these do exist)
Brake calipers: Revenge industries sealed bearings w/Ti hardware.
Brake pads: Kool stop clear w/Ti hardware.
Cranks: Profile Racing Column w/Ti spindle and gold bolts.
Sprocket: Profile Racing “Galaxy” 28T
Bottom bracket: Profile Racing 22mm gold.
Pedals: Chromag Scarab gold w/gold pins.
Chain: KMC devil 101 (best chain ever!)

Back hub: Profile Racing Z-coaster w/Ti axle and 9T Ti driver 90° slack.
Spokes: Marwie gold Ti with USA nipples.
Front hub:Profile Racing Elite w/Ti button head bolts.
Rims: G-Sport Ribcage (their something special! )
Tires/Tubes: Khe Mac2’s w/Maxxis ultralight tubes valve stem covers are gold Ti haha.
Pegs/hub guards: Profile racing aluminum pegs and aegis hub guards.
Seat: Native Bikes hand made leather “USA” flag embossed (for Evel Knievel)
Seat post: Deco pivotal custom “USA” anodized.
Post clamp: Profile Racing “slim jim”
Grips: DUO Corey Martinez
Bar ends: Deco Pac Man (profile machined)

I would like to mention my two anodizers that helped make this machine what it is. Bluesix Bikes and Industrial Metal Plating(IMP) both do awesome work right here in the USA!
Thank you Matt Coplon and Profile racing for the great friendships, years of support and the best American made parts in the game.
